Class PHold

java.lang.Object
  PHold
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Integer>, Space
public class PHold
extends java.lang.Object
implements Space, java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Integer>

When a token lands on a priority hold, they are assigned the priority equal to the number rolled to land on it. They may only leave the space when no tokens with a lower number priority are on the priority hold with them. When a token is on a priority hold and does not have the lowest number priority, they end their turn without rolling. When they are on a priority hold and do have the lowest number priority, they roll, and advance the number of spaces rolled times a number specified for that priority hold when the board is created, which will be between two numbers set in configuration.

compare

public int compare(java.lang.Integer roll1,
                   java.lang.Integer roll2)
Compare two Integer objects (rolls) for their priority in the queue. Return 1 if roll 1 is higher than roll 2, 0 if they are equal, and -1 if roll 1 is less than roll 2.

Specified by:
compare in interface java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Integer>
Parameters:
roll1 - roll 1.
roll2 - roll 2.
Returns:
1 if roll 1 is higher than roll 2, 0 if they are equal, and -1 if roll 1 is less than roll 2.

takeTurn

public boolean takeTurn(Token t,
                        Die d,
                        int boardEnd)
Take token's turn. Print the token. If the token is first in the queue, roll the die. Print the roll. If the roll is within the bounds of the board, advance the token.

Specified by:
takeTurn in interface Space
Parameters:
t - token that is taking its turn.
d - die that is used for the game.
boardEnd - the index of the final space on the board.
Returns:
if the game has ended.
